Misconfigurations.Title: Manage secrets
Misconfigurations.Description: Viewing secrets at the cluster-scope is akin to cluster-admin in most clusters as there are typically at least one service accounts (their token stored in a secret) bound to cluster-admin directly or a role/clusterrole that gives similar permissions.
Misconfigurations.Message: ClusterRole 'nirmata-kyverno-operator' shouldn't have access to manage resource 'secrets'
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Manage secrets are not allowed. Remove resource 'secrets' from cluster role

Misconfigurations.Title: Manage webhookconfigurations
Misconfigurations.Description: Webhooks can silently intercept or actively mutate/block resources as they are being created or updated. This includes secrets and pod specs.
Misconfigurations.Message: ClusterRole 'nirmata-kyverno-operator' should not have access to resources ["mutatingwebhookconfigurations", "validatingwebhookconfigurations"] for verbs ["create", "update", "patch", "delete", "deletecollection", "impersonate", "*"]
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Remove webhook configuration resouces/verbs, acceptable values for verbs ['get', 'list', 'watch']

Misconfigurations.Title: Runs with a root primary or supplementary GID
Misconfigurations.Description: According to pod security standard 'Non-root groups', containers should be forbidden from running with a root primary or supplementary GID.
Misconfigurations.Message: clusterrole nirmata-kyverno-operator in default namespace should set spec.securityContext.runAsGroup, spec.securityContext.supplementalGroups[*] and spec.securityContext.fsGroup to integer greater than 0
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsGroup' to a non-zero integer or leave undefined.

Misconfigurations.Title: Runs with a root primary or supplementary GID
Misconfigurations.Description: According to pod security standard 'Non-root groups', containers should be forbidden from running with a root primary or supplementary GID.
Misconfigurations.Message: clusterrolebinding nirmata-kyverno-operator in default namespace should set spec.securityContext.runAsGroup, spec.securityContext.supplementalGroups[*] and spec.securityContext.fsGroup to integer greater than 0
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsGroup' to a non-zero integer or leave undefined.

Misconfigurations.Title: Runs with a root primary or supplementary GID
Misconfigurations.Description: According to pod security standard 'Non-root groups', containers should be forbidden from running with a root primary or supplementary GID.
Misconfigurations.Message: configmap nirmata-kyverno-operator in null namespace should set spec.securityContext.runAsGroup, spec.securityContext.supplementalGroups[*] and spec.securityContext.fsGroup to integer greater than 0
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsGroup' to a non-zero integer or leave undefined.

Misconfigurations.Title: Runs with a root primary or supplementary GID
Misconfigurations.Description: According to pod security standard 'Non-root groups', containers should be forbidden from running with a root primary or supplementary GID.
Misconfigurations.Message: kyvernoconfig kyverno in null namespace should set spec.securityContext.runAsGroup, spec.securityContext.supplementalGroups[*] and spec.securityContext.fsGroup to integer greater than 0
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsGroup' to a non-zero integer or leave undefined.

Misconfigurations.Title: Runs with a root primary or supplementary GID
Misconfigurations.Description: According to pod security standard 'Non-root groups', containers should be forbidden from running with a root primary or supplementary GID.
Misconfigurations.Message: policyset pod-security-baseline in null namespace should set spec.securityContext.runAsGroup, spec.securityContext.supplementalGroups[*] and spec.securityContext.fsGroup to integer greater than 0
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsGroup' to a non-zero integer or leave undefined.

Misconfigurations.Title: Runs with a root primary or supplementary GID
Misconfigurations.Description: According to pod security standard 'Non-root groups', containers should be forbidden from running with a root primary or supplementary GID.
Misconfigurations.Message: policyset pod-security-restricted in null namespace should set spec.securityContext.runAsGroup, spec.securityContext.supplementalGroups[*] and spec.securityContext.fsGroup to integer greater than 0
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsGroup' to a non-zero integer or leave undefined.

Misconfigurations.Title: Runs with a root primary or supplementary GID
Misconfigurations.Description: According to pod security standard 'Non-root groups', containers should be forbidden from running with a root primary or supplementary GID.
Misconfigurations.Message: policyset rbac-best-practices in null namespace should set spec.securityContext.runAsGroup, spec.securityContext.supplementalGroups[*] and spec.securityContext.fsGroup to integer greater than 0
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsGroup' to a non-zero integer or leave undefined.

Misconfigurations.Title: Runs with a root primary or supplementary GID
Misconfigurations.Description: According to pod security standard 'Non-root groups', containers should be forbidden from running with a root primary or supplementary GID.
Misconfigurations.Message: customresourcedefinition clusterpolicyreports.wgpolicyk8s.io in default namespace should set spec.securityContext.runAsGroup, spec.securityContext.supplementalGroups[*] and spec.securityContext.fsGroup to integer greater than 0
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsGroup' to a non-zero integer or leave undefined.

Misconfigurations.Title: Runs with a root primary or supplementary GID
Misconfigurations.Description: According to pod security standard 'Non-root groups', containers should be forbidden from running with a root primary or supplementary GID.
Misconfigurations.Message: customresourcedefinition policyreports.wgpolicyk8s.io in default namespace should set spec.securityContext.runAsGroup, spec.securityContext.supplementalGroups[*] and spec.securityContext.fsGroup to integer greater than 0
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsGroup' to a non-zero integer or leave undefined.

Misconfigurations.Title: CPU not limited
Misconfigurations.Description: Enforcing CPU limits prevents DoS via resource exhaustion.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'nirmata-kyverno-operator' of Deployment 'nirmata-kyverno-operator' should set 'resources.limits.cpu'
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set a limit value under 'containers[].resources.limits.cpu'.

Misconfigurations.Title: CPU requests not specified
Misconfigurations.Description: When containers have resource requests specified, the scheduler can make better decisions about which nodes to place pods on, and how to deal with resource contention.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'nirmata-kyverno-operator' of Deployment 'nirmata-kyverno-operator' should set 'resources.requests.cpu'
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'containers[].resources.requests.cpu'.

Misconfigurations.Title: Memory requests not specified
Misconfigurations.Description: When containers have memory requests specified, the scheduler can make better decisions about which nodes to place pods on, and how to deal with resource contention.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'nirmata-kyverno-operator' of Deployment 'nirmata-kyverno-operator' should set 'resources.requests.memory'
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'containers[].resources.requests.memory'.

Misconfigurations.Title: Runs with UID <= 10000
Misconfigurations.Description: Force the container to run with user ID > 10000 to avoid conflicts with the host’s user table.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'nirmata-kyverno-operator' of Deployment 'nirmata-kyverno-operator' should set 'securityContext.runAsUser' > 10000
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsUser' to an integer > 10000.

Misconfigurations.Title: Runs with GID <= 10000
Misconfigurations.Description: Force the container to run with group ID > 10000 to avoid conflicts with the host’s user table.
Misconfigurations.Message: Container 'nirmata-kyverno-operator' of Deployment 'nirmata-kyverno-operator' should set 'securityContext.runAsGroup' > 10000
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsGroup' to an integer > 10000.

Misconfigurations.Title: Seccomp policies disabled
Misconfigurations.Description: A program inside the container can bypass Seccomp protection policies.
Misconfigurations.Message: container nirmata-kyverno-operator of deployment nirmata-kyverno-operator in null namespace should specify a seccomp profile
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Specify seccomp either by annotation or by seccomp profile type having allowed values as per pod security standards

Misconfigurations.Title: Runs with a root primary or supplementary GID
Misconfigurations.Description: According to pod security standard 'Non-root groups', containers should be forbidden from running with a root primary or supplementary GID.
Misconfigurations.Message: deployment nirmata-kyverno-operator in null namespace should set spec.securityContext.runAsGroup, spec.securityContext.supplementalGroups[*] and spec.securityContext.fsGroup to integer greater than 0
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsGroup' to a non-zero integer or leave undefined.

Misconfigurations.Title: Manage all resources
Misconfigurations.Description: Full control of the cluster resources, and therefore also root on all nodes where workloads can run and has access to all pods, secrets, and data.
Misconfigurations.Message: ClusterRole 'kyverno:admission-controller:core' shouldn't manage all resources
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Remove '*' from 'rules.resources'. Provide specific list of resources to be managed by cluster role

Misconfigurations.Title: Manage webhookconfigurations
Misconfigurations.Description: Webhooks can silently intercept or actively mutate/block resources as they are being created or updated. This includes secrets and pod specs.
Misconfigurations.Message: ClusterRole 'kyverno:admission-controller:core' should not have access to resources ["mutatingwebhookconfigurations", "validatingwebhookconfigurations"] for verbs ["create", "update", "patch", "delete", "deletecollection", "impersonate", "*"]
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Remove webhook configuration resouces/verbs, acceptable values for verbs ['get', 'list', 'watch']

Misconfigurations.Title: Runs with a root primary or supplementary GID
Misconfigurations.Description: According to pod security standard 'Non-root groups', containers should be forbidden from running with a root primary or supplementary GID.
Misconfigurations.Message: clusterrole kyverno:admission-controller in default namespace should set spec.securityContext.runAsGroup, spec.securityContext.supplementalGroups[*] and spec.securityContext.fsGroup to integer greater than 0
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsGroup' to a non-zero integer or leave undefined.

Misconfigurations.Title: Runs with a root primary or supplementary GID
Misconfigurations.Description: According to pod security standard 'Non-root groups', containers should be forbidden from running with a root primary or supplementary GID.
Misconfigurations.Message: clusterrole kyverno:admission-controller:core in default namespace should set spec.securityContext.runAsGroup, spec.securityContext.supplementalGroups[*] and spec.securityContext.fsGroup to integer greater than 0
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsGroup' to a non-zero integer or leave undefined.

Misconfigurations.Title: Runs with a root primary or supplementary GID

Misconfigurations.Message: clusterrolebinding kyverno:admission-controller in default namespace should set spec.securityContext.runAsGroup, spec.securityContext.supplementalGroups[*] and spec.securityContext.fsGroup to integer greater than 0
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsGroup' to a non-zero integer or leave undefined.

Misconfigurations.Title: Manage namespace secrets
Misconfigurations.Description: Viewing secrets at the namespace scope can lead to escalation if another service account in that namespace has a higher privileged rolebinding or clusterrolebinding bound.
Misconfigurations.Message: Role 'kyverno:admission-controller' shouldn't have access to manage secrets in namespace 'kyverno'
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Manage namespace secrets are not allowed. Remove resource 'secrets' from role

Misconfigurations.Title: Runs with a root primary or supplementary GID
Misconfigurations.Description: According to pod security standard 'Non-root groups', containers should be forbidden from running with a root primary or supplementary GID.
Misconfigurations.Message: role kyverno:admission-controller in kyverno namespace should set spec.securityContext.runAsGroup, spec.securityContext.supplementalGroups[*] and spec.securityContext.fsGroup to integer greater than 0
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsGroup' to a non-zero integer or leave undefined.

Misconfigurations.Message: rolebinding kyverno:admission-controller in kyverno namespace should set spec.securityContext.runAsGroup, spec.securityContext.supplementalGroups[*] and spec.securityContext.fsGroup to integer greater than 0
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsGroup' to a non-zero integer or leave undefined.

Misconfigurations.Message: serviceaccount kyverno-admission-controller in kyverno namespace should set spec.securityContext.runAsGroup, spec.securityContext.supplementalGroups[*] and spec.securityContext.fsGroup to integer greater than 0
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsGroup' to a non-zero integer or leave undefined.

Misconfigurations.Title: Manage secrets
Misconfigurations.Description: Viewing secrets at the cluster-scope is akin to cluster-admin in most clusters as there are typically at least one service accounts (their token stored in a secret) bound to cluster-admin directly or a role/clusterrole that gives similar permissions.
Misconfigurations.Message: ClusterRole 'kyverno:background-controller:core' shouldn't have access to manage resource 'secrets'
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Manage secrets are not allowed. Remove resource 'secrets' from cluster role

Misconfigurations.Title: Manage all resources
Misconfigurations.Description: Full control of the cluster resources, and therefore also root on all nodes where workloads can run and has access to all pods, secrets, and data.
Misconfigurations.Message: ClusterRole 'kyverno:background-controller:core' shouldn't manage all resources
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Remove '*' from 'rules.resources'. Provide specific list of resources to be managed by cluster role

Misconfigurations.Title: Manage configmaps
Misconfigurations.Description: Some workloads leverage configmaps to store sensitive data or configuration parameters that affect runtime behavior that can be modified by an attacker or combined with another issue to potentially lead to compromise.
Misconfigurations.Message: ClusterRole 'kyverno:background-controller:core' should not have access to resource 'configmaps' for verbs ["create", "update", "patch", "delete", "deletecollection", "impersonate", "*"]
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Remove write permission verbs for resource 'configmaps'

Misconfigurations.Title: Manage Kubernetes RBAC resources
Misconfigurations.Description: An effective level of access equivalent to cluster-admin should not be provided.
Misconfigurations.Message: ClusterRole 'kyverno:background-controller:core' should not have access to resources ["roles", "rolebindings"] for verbs ["create", "update", "delete", "deletecollection", "impersonate", "*"]
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Remove write permission verbs for resource 'roles' and 'rolebindings'

Misconfigurations.Title: Manage Kubernetes networking
Misconfigurations.Description: The ability to control which pods get service traffic directed to them allows for interception attacks. Controlling network policy allows for bypassing lateral movement restrictions.
Misconfigurations.Message: ClusterRole 'kyverno:background-controller:core' should not have access to resources ["services", "endpoints", "endpointslices", "networkpolicies", "ingresses"] for verbs ["create", "update", "patch", "delete", "deletecollection", "impersonate", "*"]
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Networking resources are only allowed for verbs 'list', 'watch', 'get'

Misconfigurations.Title: Runs with a root primary or supplementary GID
Misconfigurations.Description: According to pod security standard 'Non-root groups', containers should be forbidden from running with a root primary or supplementary GID.
Misconfigurations.Message: clusterrole kyverno:background-controller in default namespace should set spec.securityContext.runAsGroup, spec.securityContext.supplementalGroups[*] and spec.securityContext.fsGroup to integer greater than 0
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsGroup' to a non-zero integer or leave undefined.

Misconfigurations.Title: Manage Kubernetes workloads and pods
Misconfigurations.Description: Depending on the policies enforced by the admission controller, this permission ranges from the ability to steal compute (crypto) by running workloads or allowing for creating workloads that escape to the node as root and escalation to cluster-admin.
Misconfigurations.Message: ClusterRole 'kyverno:cleanup-controller:core' should not have access to resources ["pods", "deployments", "jobs", "cronjobs", "statefulsets", "daemonsets", "replicasets", "replicationcontrollers"] for verbs ["create", "update", "patch", "delete", "deletecollection", "impersonate", "*"]
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Kubernetes workloads resources are only allowed for verbs 'list', 'watch', 'get'

Misconfigurations.Title: Manage webhookconfigurations
Misconfigurations.Description: Webhooks can silently intercept or actively mutate/block resources as they are being created or updated. This includes secrets and pod specs.

Misconfigurations.Title: Runs with a root primary or supplementary GID
Misconfigurations.Description: According to pod security standard 'Non-root groups', containers should be forbidden from running with a root primary or supplementary GID.
Misconfigurations.Message: customresourcedefinition policyexceptions.kyverno.io in default namespace should set spec.securityContext.runAsGroup, spec.securityContext.supplementalGroups[*] and spec.securityContext.fsGroup to integer greater than 0
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsGroup' to a non-zero integer or leave undefined.

Misconfigurations.Title: Runs with a root primary or supplementary GID
Misconfigurations.Description: According to pod security standard 'Non-root groups', containers should be forbidden from running with a root primary or supplementary GID.

Misconfigurations.Resolution: Set 'containers[].securityContext.runAsGroup' to a non-zero integer or leave undefined.

Misconfigurations.Title: No wildcard verb and resource roles
Misconfigurations.Description: Check whether role permits wildcard verb on wildcard resource
Misconfigurations.Message: Role permits wildcard verb on wildcard resource
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Create a role which does not permit wildcard verb on wildcard resource

Misconfigurations.Title: Manage all resources at the namespace
Misconfigurations.Description: Full control of the resources within a namespace.  In some cluster configurations, this is excessive. In others, this is normal (a gitops deployment operator like flux)
Misconfigurations.Message: Role 'kyverno-installer' shouldn't manage all resources at the namespace 'kyverno'
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Remove '*' from 'rules.resources'. Provide specific list of resources to be managed by role in namespace

Misconfigurations.Title: Manage all resources
Misconfigurations.Description: Full control of the cluster resources, and therefore also root on all nodes where workloads can run and has access to all pods, secrets, and data.
Misconfigurations.Message: ClusterRole 'kyverno:reports-controller:core' shouldn't manage all resources
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Remove '*' from 'rules.resources'. Provide specific list of resources to be managed by cluster role

Misconfigurations.Resolution: Create a role which does not permit wildcard verb on wildcard resource

Misconfigurations.Title: Manage Kubernetes workloads and pods
Misconfigurations.Description: Depending on the policies enforced by the admission controller, this permission ranges from the ability to steal compute (crypto) by running workloads or allowing for creating workloads that escape to the node as root and escalation to cluster-admin.
Misconfigurations.Message: Role 'nirmata-kyverno-operator' should not have access to resources ["pods", "deployments", "jobs", "cronjobs", "statefulsets", "daemonsets", "replicasets", "replicationcontrollers"] for verbs ["create", "update", "patch", "delete", "deletecollection", "impersonate", "*"]
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Kubernetes workloads resources are only allowed for verbs 'list', 'watch', 'get'

Misconfigurations.Title: Manage all resources at the namespace
Misconfigurations.Description: Full control of the resources within a namespace.  In some cluster configurations, this is excessive. In others, this is normal (a gitops deployment operator like flux)
Misconfigurations.Message: Role 'nirmata-kyverno-operator-installer' shouldn't manage all resources at the namespace 'null'
Misconfigurations.Resolution: Remove '*' from 'rules.resources'. Provide specific list of resources to be managed by role in namespace
